item.description:
The Isabella Stewart Gardner Museum does a "Third Thursday" evening event each month.
This month's event is "Buon Novo"
Celebrate the New Year and new beginnings. Did you know Gardner actually opened her museum to the public on the evening of January 1st, 1903? Sure it’s been a few weeks since New Year’s but we’ll celebrate just like Gardner did back in the day with champagne and donuts!

The evening includes:
Courtyard Music:
Violinist Emil Altschuler and guitarist Jerome Mouffe perform from 5:30-7pm and then again from 8:15-9pm.
Gallery Talk @ 7pm:
Stop by the special exhibition gallery for a talk about the exhibition by artist Taro Shinoda
Viewfinder Conversations:
Join a discussion about John S. Sargent’s famous portrait of Isabella Gardner (every half-hour), plus other impromptu gallery discussions (6 to 8:30PM)
Sketching in the Galleries:
Drop by the Dutch Room and sketch for a while, from 6-9pm.

And whatever else lies in store!

For more info and to buy tickets, go to Gardner After Hours - January 2010
item.how_to_find_us: We will meet inside the bar area - go straight thru the entrance & down a few steps & you're there.
item.name: Isabella Stewart Gardner "After Hours" Evening
